name: zero_add

proof:

| zero =>

| succ d =>

name: le_two
statement: theorem le_two (x : MyNat) (hx : le x two) : x = zero ∨ x = one ∨ x = two := by
proof:
obtain ⟨c, hc⟩ := hx
rw [le_iff_exists_add] at hc
rw [two_eq_succ_one] at hc
cases c with
| zero =>
  rw [add_zero] at hc
  exact Or.inr (Or.inr rfl)
| succ d =>
  rw [add_succ] at hc
  cases hc with
  | rfl =>
    exact Or.inr (Or.inl rfl)
  | h =>
    rw [← succ_eq_add_one] at h
    exact Or.inl (pred_succ (succ d))

name: mul_right_eq_one
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
proof:
cases y with
| zero =>
  rw [mul_zero] at h
  contradiction
| succ d =>
  rw [mul_succ] at h
  have : add (mul x d) x = one := h

  -- We will show that this leads to mul x d = zero
  -- Thus, we can conclude x = one

name: mul_eq_zero
statement: theorem mul_eq_zero (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b = zero) : a = zero ∨ b = zero := by
proof:
induction b with d hd
  case zero =>
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    left
    exact h
  case succ d ih =>
    rw [mul_succ] at h
    have : add (mul a d) a = zero := h
    apply add_right_eq_zero.mp this
    right
    apply ih
    exact mul_ne_zero a d (ne_of_eq_zero this)

name: mul_left_cancel
statement: theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
proof:
have hbc : mul a b = mul a c := h
have h1 : mul a b ≠ zero := by
  intro h2
  apply ha
  rw [h2] at hbc
  exact mul_eq_zero a b hbc
have h2 : mul a c ≠ zero := by
  intro h3
  apply ha
  rw [h3] at hbc
  exact mul_eq_zero a c hbc
apply mul_left_ne_zero a b c ha
exact hbc

statement: theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
proof:
cases b with
| zero =>
  have h1 : mul a zero = zero := mul_zero a
  contradiction

  rw [mul_succ a c] at h
  rw [h] at h
  rw [add_right_eq_self a (mul a c)] at h
  exact zero_ne_succ a
